chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond of $300.00 has been applied towards the costs.  The remaining costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with the treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes: The jail sentence may be served with huber.  The jail sentence shall begin no later than July 22, 20222 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Anderson

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

2:34 PM Defendant Kyle J. Anderson in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tayyibah Ingrid Sethi appeared by phone for Kyle J. Anderson. Plea agreement recited into the record - Count 1 in 22CF22 is amended to 943.23(3m)  Plea of no contest to Counts 1 and 4 in 22CF22 and to Count 2 in 21CM80.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 4 in 22CF22 and Count 2 in 21CM80. Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts and 21CM48.   Statement by Attorney Sethi. Statement by defendant.  Court orders in 21CM80- Sentence withheld and probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge; domestic abuse surcharge; attend and complete domestic violence counseling.   Court orders in 22CF22 - court orders withheld sentence placement on probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; letter of apology to the victim;  Count 1 only - 10 days county jail with huber to begin no later than July 22, at 4:30 pm.   - 21CM80 - 1 day of sentence credit and 22CF22 - 4 days of sentence credit.   Costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:30 AM Defendant Kyle J. Anderson in court with attorney Tayyibah Ingrid Sethi by audio and video through Zoom.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim notification has been complied.  Parties agree that a resolution has been reached and plea and sentencing should be scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm. - rt

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall have no contact with G.B.S. - dob: 3-24-2002 and J.S.D. - dob: 08-03-1971.
Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kyle J. Anderson in court with attorney Nick Smith, appearing specially.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Attorney Fuhr is requesting an additional no contact with J.S.D. - dob:  8-3-1971.  So ordered by the Court.  Defendant to sign new bond with additional no contact.  Bond continued. - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall have no contact with G.B.S. - dob: 3-24-2002.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle J. Anderson appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tayyibah Ingrid Sethi appeared for the defendant by audio and video through Zoom.  Probable cause has been previously found.  Victim notification has been complied.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with G.B.S. - dob:  3-24-2002; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid prescription; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Statement by Attorney Sethi.  Court orders a $300.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with G.B.S. - dob:  3-24-2002; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid prescription; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CM48 and 21CM80.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  - rt
